00028 /* Includes ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00029 #include "ht32f5xxxx_rtc.h"

00041 /* Private constants ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00042 /** @defgroup RTC_Private_Define RTC private definitions
00043   * @{
00044   */
00045 #define RPRE_MASK     (0xFFFFF0FF)
00046 
00047 /**
00048   * @}
00049   */
00050 
00051 /* Global functions ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00052 /** @defgroup RTC_Exported_Functions RTC exported functions
00053   * @{
00054   */
00055 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00056  * @brief Deinitialize the RTC peripheral registers to their default reset values.
00057  * @retval None
00058  ************************************************************************************************************/
00059 void RTC_DeInit(void)
00060 {
00061   HT_RTC->CR = 0x00000004;
00062   HT_RTC->CMP = 0x0;
00063   HT_RTC->IWEN = 0x0;
00064   HT_RTC->CR |= 0x00000005;
00065   while (HT_RTC->CNT);
00066   HT_RTC->CR = 0x00000F04;
00067   /* Read the RTC_SR register to clear it                                                                   */
00068   HT_RTC->SR;
00069 }
00070 
00071 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00072  * @brief Select the RTC timer clock source.
00073  * @param Source: specify the clock source of RTC and backup domain.
00074  *   @arg RTC_SRC_LSI : Low speed internal clock.
00075  *   @arg RTC_SRC_LSE : Low speed external clock.
00076  * @retval None
00077  ************************************************************************************************************/
00078 void RTC_ClockSourceConfig(RTC_SRC_Enum Source)
00079 {
00080   Assert_Param(IS_RTC_SRC(Source));
00081 
00082   HT_RTC->CR = (HT_RTC->CR & ~(1UL << 1)) | ((u32)Source << 1);
00083 }
00084 
00085 #if (LIBCFG_RTC_LSI_LOAD_TRIM)
00086 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00087  * @brief Loads the LSI trim data.
00088  * @retval None
00089  ************************************************************************************************************/
00090 void RTC_LSILoadTrimData(void)
00091 {
00092   u32 i = 4800;
00093   u32 isRTCEnable = HT_CKCU->APBCCR1 & (1 << 6);
00094 
00095   HT_CKCU->APBCCR1 |= 1 << 6;
00096   HT_RTC->CR &= ~(1UL << 2);
00097   /* Insert a delay must > 1 CK_RTC                                                                         */
00098   while (i--);
00099   HT_RTC->CR |= (1UL << 2);
00100   while ((HT_CKCU->GCSR & 0x20) == 0);
00101 
00102   if (isRTCEnable == 0)
00103     HT_CKCU->APBCCR1 &= ~(1 << 6);
00104 }
00105 #endif
00106 
00107 #if (LIBCFG_LSE)
00108 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00109  * @brief Select the LSE startup mode.
00110  * @param Mode: specify the LSE startup mode.
00111  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00112  *     @arg RTC_LSESM_NORMAL : Little power consumption but longer startup time.
00113  *     @arg RTC_LSESM_FAST   : Shortly startup time but higher power consumption.
00114  * @retval None
00115  ************************************************************************************************************/
00116 void RTC_LSESMConfig(RTC_LSESM_Enum Mode)
00117 {
00118   Assert_Param(IS_RTC_LSESM(Mode));
00119 
00120   HT_RTC->CR = (HT_RTC->CR & ~(1UL << 5)) | ((u32)Mode << 5);
00121 }
00122 
00123 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00124  * @brief Enable or Disable the LSE clock.
00125  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00126  * @retval None
00127  ************************************************************************************************************/
00128 void RTC_LSECmd(ControlStatus NewState)
00129 {
00130   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00131 
00132   if (NewState == DISABLE)
00133   {
00134     HT_RTC->CR &= ~(1UL << 3);
00135   }
00136   else
00137   {
00138     HT_RTC->CR |= (1UL << 3);
00139   }
00140 }
00141 #endif
00142 
00143 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00144  * @brief Enable or Disable the compare match function.
00145  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00146  * @retval None
00147  ************************************************************************************************************/
00148 void RTC_CMPCLRCmd(ControlStatus NewState)
00149 {
00150   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00151 
00152   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00153   {
00154     HT_RTC->CR |= (1UL << 4);
00155   }
00156   else
00157   {
00158     HT_RTC->CR &= ~(1UL << 4);
00159   }
00160 }
00161 
00162 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00163  * @brief Configure the RTC prescaler.
00164  * @param Psc: Value of RTC prescaler.
00165  *   This parameter can be one of following values:
00166  *     @arg RTC_RPRE_1
00167  *     @arg RTC_RPRE_2
00168  *     @arg RTC_RPRE_4
00169  *     @arg RTC_RPRE_8
00170  *     @arg RTC_RPRE_16
00171  *     @arg RTC_RPRE_32
00172  *     @arg RTC_RPRE_64
00173  *     @arg RTC_RPRE_128
00174  *     @arg RTC_RPRE_256
00175  *     @arg RTC_RPRE_512
00176  *     @arg RTC_RPRE_1024
00177  *     @arg RTC_RPRE_2048
00178  *     @arg RTC_RPRE_4096
00179  *     @arg RTC_RPRE_8192
00180  *     @arg RTC_RPRE_16384
00181  *     @arg RTC_RPRE_32768
00182  * @retval None
00183  ************************************************************************************************************/
00184 void RTC_SetPrescaler(RTC_RPRE_Enum Psc)
00185 {
00186   Assert_Param(IS_RTC_PSC(Psc));
00187 
00188   HT_RTC->CR = (HT_RTC->CR & RPRE_MASK) | Psc;
00189 }
00190 
00191 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00192  * @brief Return the RTC prescaler setting.
00193  * @retval The prescaler value. It is powered by 2 and max.is 32768.
00194  ************************************************************************************************************/
00195 u16 RTC_GetPrescaler(void)
00196 {
00197   u32 prescaler;
00198 
00199   prescaler = HT_RTC->CR >> 8;
00200 
00201   return ((u16)0x1 << prescaler);
00202 }
00203 
00204 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00205  * @brief Enable or Disable the RTC timer.
00206  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00207  * @retval None
00208  ************************************************************************************************************/
00209 void RTC_Cmd(ControlStatus NewState)
00210 {
00211   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00212   {
00213     HT_RTC->CR |= (1UL);
00214   }
00215   else
00216   {
00217     HT_RTC->CR &= ~(1UL);
00218   }
00219 }
00220 
00221 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00222  * @brief Return the counter value.
00223  * @retval Between 0x0 ~ 0xFFFFFFFF.
00224  ************************************************************************************************************/
00225 u32 RTC_GetCounter(void)
00226 {
00227   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00228      A 1/CK_RTC delay time is required if you read the RTC CNT count immediately when the RTC compare match
00229      occurred (in the RTC ISR or the system is wakeup from the DeepSleep1/2).
00230      The CK_RTC can be configured from the LSI or LSE.
00231   */
00232   return (HT_RTC->CNT);
00233 }
00234 
00235 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00236  * @brief Configure the compare match value.
00237  * @param Compare: Between 0x0 ~ 0xFFFFFFFF
00238  * @retval None
00239  ************************************************************************************************************/
00240 void RTC_SetCompare(u32 Compare)
00241 {
00242   HT_RTC->CMP = Compare;
00243 }
00244 
00245 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00246  * @brief Return the compare match value.
00247  * @retval Between 0x0 ~ 0xFFFFFFFF.
00248  ************************************************************************************************************/
00249 u32 RTC_GetCompare(void)
00250 {
00251   return (HT_RTC->CMP);
00252 }
00253 
00254 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00255  * @brief Enable or Disable the specified wakeup source.
00256  * @param RTC_WAKEUP Selection of Wakeup source.
00257  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00258  *   @arg RTC_WAKEUP_CSEC : Waken up by counter counting.
00259  *   @arg RTC_WAKEUP_CM   : Waken up by counter compare match with CMP register.
00260  *   @arg RTC_WAKEUP_OV   : Waken up by counter overflow.
00261  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00262  * @retval None
00263  ************************************************************************************************************/
00264 void RTC_WakeupConfig(u32 RTC_WAKEUP, ControlStatus NewState)
00265 {
00266   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00267   Assert_Param(IS_RTC_WAKEUP(RTC_WAKEUP));
00268 
00269   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00270   {
00271     HT_RTC->IWEN |= RTC_WAKEUP;
00272   }
00273   else
00274   {
00275     HT_RTC->IWEN &= ~RTC_WAKEUP;
00276   }
00277 }
00278 
00279 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00280  * @brief Enable or Disable the specified interrupt source.
00281  * @param RTC_INT: Selection of Wakeup source.
00282  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00283  *     @arg RTC_INT_CSEC : Assert interrupt at counter counting
00284  *     @arg RTC_INT_CM   : Assert interrupt at counter compare match with CMP register
00285  *     @arg RTC_INT_OV   : Assert interrupt at counter overflow
00286  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00287  * @retval None
00288  ************************************************************************************************************/
00289 void RTC_IntConfig(u32 RTC_INT, ControlStatus NewState)
00290 {
00291   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00292   Assert_Param(IS_RTC_INT(RTC_INT));
00293 
00294   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00295   {
00296     HT_RTC->IWEN |= RTC_INT;
00297   }
00298   else
00299   {
00300     HT_RTC->IWEN &= ~RTC_INT;
00301   }
00302 }
00303 
00304 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00305  * @brief Return the RTC flags.
00306  * @retval RTC_STS register value.
00307  *   This parameter can be any combination of following:
00308  *   - 0x0 : No flag set
00309  *   - 0x1 : Count flag
00310  *   - 0x2 : Match flag
00311  *   - 0x4 : Overflow flag
00312  * @note RTC_SR is read clear.
00313  ************************************************************************************************************/
00314 u8 RTC_GetFlagStatus(void)
00315 {
00316   return ((u8)HT_RTC->SR);
00317 }
00318 
00319 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00320  * @brief Configure the RTC output function.
00321  * @param WMode: specify the RTC output waveform mode
00322  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00323  *     @arg RTC_ROWM_PULSE : Pulse mode
00324  *     @arg RTC_ROWM_LEVEL : Level mode
00325  * @param EventSel: specify the RTC output event selection
00326  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00327  *     @arg RTC_ROES_MATCH  : Compare match selected
00328  *     @arg RTC_ROES_SECOND : Second clock selected
00329  * @param Pol: specify the RTC output active polarity
00330  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00331  *     @arg RTC_ROAP_HIGH : Active level is high
00332  *     @arg RTC_ROAP_LOW  : Active level is low
00333  * @note This function will disable RTC output first.
00334  ************************************************************************************************************/
00335 void RTC_OutConfig(RTC_ROWM_Enum WMode, RTC_ROES_Enum EventSel, RTC_ROAP_Enum Pol)
00336 {
00337   Assert_Param(IS_RTC_ROWM(WMode));
00338   Assert_Param(IS_RTC_ROES(EventSel));
00339   Assert_Param(IS_RTC_ROAP(Pol));
00340 
00341   HT_RTC->CR &= ~(1UL << 16);
00342   HT_RTC->CR = (HT_RTC->CR & ~(1UL << 18)) | ((u32)WMode << 18);
00343   HT_RTC->CR = (HT_RTC->CR & ~(1UL << 17)) | ((u32)EventSel << 17);
00344   HT_RTC->CR = (HT_RTC->CR & ~(1UL << 19)) | ((u32)Pol << 19);
00345 }
00346 
00347 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00348  * @brief Enable or Disable the RTC output.
00349  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00350  * @retval None
00351  ************************************************************************************************************/
00352 void RTC_OutCmd(ControlStatus NewState)
00353 {
00354   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00355 
00356   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00357   {
00358     HT_RTC->CR |= (1UL << 16);
00359   }
00360   else
00361   {
00362     HT_RTC->CR &= ~(1UL << 16);
00363   }
00364 }
00365 
00366 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00367  * @brief Return the RTCOUT level mode flag.
00368  * @retval SET or RESET
00369  * @note Reads RTC_CR action will clear ROLF flag.
00370  ************************************************************************************************************/
00371 FlagStatus RTC_GetOutStatus(void)
00372 {
00373   if (HT_RTC->CR & (1UL << 20))
00374   {
00375     return SET;
00376   }
00377   else
00378   {
00379     return RESET;
00380   }
00381 }
